rules: Rule1: If the Organization has revoked the license for the Platform, then the Platform maintains proper documentation for the Drug or, provided that the Platform has verified the safety of the Drug, it is compliant with regulations for the Drug.

Rule2: Whenever the Organization has suspended the operations of the Platform, the Platform maintains proper documentation for the Drug or, if the Platform has verified the safety of the Drug, then it is compliant with regulations for the Drug.
Rule3: Provided that the Organization has found a violation by the Platform, then the Organization has revoked the license for the Platform.
Rule4: The Organization has found a violation by the Platform or the Organization has reported an incident involving the Platform.
Rule5: Under the condition that the Organization has reported an incident involving the Platform, the Organization has suspended the operations of the Platform.
Rule6: If the Platform imposes an alcohol restriction on Alcohol, then the Platform has an alcohol ban on Alcohol.

Rule7: Either the Platform has filed an appeal with the Organization or, under the condition that the Platform imposes an alcohol restriction on Alcohol, the Organization exercises government oversight over the Platform.

Rule8: Provided that the Platform has submitted a formal complaint to the Organization, then either the Platform is taking legal action against the Organization or the Platform has not filed an appeal with the Organization.
Rule9: The Platform has submitted a formal complaint to the Organization or the Platform has filed a protest with the Organization.
Rule10: If there is contradictory evidence regarding the Substance on the Platform, then the Substance is used safely on the Platform.
Rule11: Whenever there is contradictory evidence regarding the Substance on the Platform, it is not the case that the Substance is used safely on the Platform.
Rule12: Under the condition that there is contradictory evidence regarding the Substance on the Platform, the Substance does not have harmful effects on the Platform.
Rule13: The Platform has banned the Substance or, if the Organization does not exercise government oversight over the Platform, then the Organization has approved the Drug.
Rule14: If the Platform is compliance certified for the Drug, then the Organization exercises government oversight over the Platform.
Rule15: Provided that the Platform has temporary approval for the Drug, the Organization exercises government oversight over the Platform.
Rule16: Under the condition that the Platform has full approval for the Drug, then the Platform is compliance certified for the Drug.
Rule17: Whenever the Platform has conditional approval for the Drug, then the Platform has temporary approval for the Drug.
Rule18: The Drug is market ready on the Platform or the Drug has experimental status on the Platform.
Rule19: Provided that the Drug has experimental status on the Platform, the Platform has conditional approval for the Drug.
Rule20: If the Platform violates policy concerning the Substance, then it is not the case that the Platform has banned the Substance.
Rule21: The Platform violates policy concerning the Substance or the Platform engages in illegal distribution of the Substance.

Rule22: Provided that the Substance has been peer reviewed on the Platform, then if an expert report exists concerning the Substance on the Platform, whenever there is contradictory evidence regarding the Substance on the Platform, the Substance has harmful effects on the Platform.
Rule23: The Organization performs a license check on the Platform or the Organization conducts a compliance investigation of the Platform.

Rule24: Whenever the Organization conducts a compliance investigation of the Platform, then the Platform holds a valid license for the Substance or contradictory evidence regarding the Substance on the Platform does not exist.
Rule25: If the Platform has a distribution ban on the Substance, then the Platform imposes a complete restriction on the Substance.

Rule26: The Platform has a distribution ban on the Substance or, under the condition that the Organization performs a license check on the Platform, then either the Platform holds a valid license for the Substance or there is no contradictory evidence regarding the Substance on the Platform.
Rule27: Provided that the Platform imposes a complete restriction on the Substance, then the Platform enforces total prohibition of the Substance.

Rule28: Under the condition that the Organization issues a regulatory order to the Platform, then either the Platform has a partial ban on the Substance or total prohibition of the Substance is not in effect.
Rule29: The Organization issues a regulatory order to the Platform or the Organization takes enforcement action against the Platform.

Rule30: The Organization has granted an appeal from the Platform or, under the condition that the Organization takes enforcement action against the Platform, then either the Platform has a partial ban on the Substance or total prohibition of the Substance is not present.
Rule31: The Organization has imposed a penalty on the Platform or the Platform has not filed an appeal with the Organization.
Rule32: Provided that the Organization has waived a penalty for the Platform, then the Organization has not imposed a penalty on the Platform.
Rule33: Under the condition that the Platform has an alcohol ban on Alcohol, then the Platform enforces strict control on Alcohol.
Rule34: If the Platform enforces strict control on Alcohol, then the Organization exercises government oversight over the Platform.
Rule35: Provided that the Organization conducts a regulatory audit of the Platform, then if the Platform engages in illegal distribution of the Substance, the Platform has not banned the Substance.
Rule36: The Platform has verified the safety of the Drug or the Platform grants emergency approval for the Drug.
Rule37: Whenever the Platform grants emergency approval for the Drug, the Organization exercises government oversight over the Platform.

Rule38: If it is not the case that whenever the Platform has filed a protest with the Organization, then either the Platform is taking legal action against the Organization or the Platform has not filed an appeal with the Organization, then there is contradictory evidence regarding the Substance on the Platform.

Rule39: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the Drug is market ready on the Platform, then the Platform has full approval for the Drug, then the Drug is undergoing clinical trials on the Platform.

Rule40: Provided that it is not the case that whenever the Drug is market ready on the Platform, the Platform has full approval for the Drug, then the Drug is not undergoing clinical trials on the Platform.
facts: Fact1: The Platform imposes an alcohol restriction on Alcohol.
Fact2: An expert report exists concerning the Substance on the Platform.
Fact3: The Substance has been peer reviewed on the Platform.
Fact4: The Organization has waived a penalty for the Platform.
Fact5: The Organization conducts a regulatory audit of the Platform.
Fact6: It is not the case that the Organization has approved the Drug.
Fact7: The Platform is not taking legal action against the Organization.
Fact8: The Platform does not hold a valid license for the Substance.
Fact9: The Platform does not have a partial ban on the Substance.
Fact10: The Organization has not granted an appeal from the Platform.
Fact11: The Platform is not compliant with regulations for the Drug.
Fact12: The Platform does not maintain proper documentation for the Drug.

question: The Organization exercises government oversight over the Platform.
